content:
Although contemporary dance may not be a significant part of traditional Broadway productions, several recent shows have incorporated elements of contemporary dance in their choreography, adding a fresh and modern feel to the dance numbers. Here are a few examples: 

1. "Spring Awakening" - The 2015 revival of "Spring Awakening" incorporated elements of modern dance to bring new life to the show's rock score. The production was choreographed by Spencer Liff, who's known for his contemporary dance background.

2. "Fun Home" - The 2015 winner of the Best Musical Tony Award featured contemporary dance numbers that helped to convey the show's emotional moments. The choreography was done by David Neumann, a contemporary choreographer.

3. "Natasha, Pierre & The Great Comet of 1812" - This high-energy musical, which features a mix of pop and traditional Russian music's fusion, includes a lot of contemporary dance in its choreography that complements the musical's modern sensibility. 

4. "In the Heights" - Lin-Manuel Miranda's hit show runs has modernized and added a contemporary edge to traditional Latin American dance used in salsa and tango styles.

These are just a few examples of Broadway productions with contemporary dance elements. It's worth noting that Broadway choreographers are continually experimenting with new and exciting ways to incorporate different dance styles into their productions.
